Package edu.uky.cs.nil.sabre.logic

Interface Atom

All Superinterfaces:
Comparable<Logical>, Expression, Logical, Proposition, Serializable, Simplifiable, Typed
All Known Implementing Classes:
Effect, Precondition
public interface Atom extends Proposition
An atom is a Proposition which cannot be further simplified (meaning simplify() always returns this atom itself).
Author:
Stephen G. Ware

    Returns an expression which represents a character's beliefs about this expression.

    • combine

      Atom combine(Atom other)
      If a conjunction of this atom and a given atom can be simplified to a single atom, this method returns that atom; if not, null is returned. If this method returns null, it does not mean the atoms are contradictory (see negates(Atom)), only that they cannot be combined into a single atom.
      Parameters:
      other - the other atom which can possibly be combined with this one
      Returns:
      a single atom which expresses both this atom and the given atom, or null if no such atom exists

    • negates

      boolean negates(Atom other)
      Tests whether a conjunction of this atom and a given atom would be a contradiction.
      Parameters:
      other - the other atom which might contradict this one
      Returns:
      true if the atoms contradict one another, false otherwise
